Sentence: Darwin's tubercle is a small, visible bump or protrusion on the upper rim of the ear, named after Charles Darwin.
Label: Definition

Sentence: It is considered a vestigial trait, thought to be a remnant of the pointy ears found in some of our evolutionary ancestors.
Label: Explanation

Sentence: Though it is not present in all humans, Darwin's tubercle is a common and harmless feature in many individuals.
Label: Generalization

Sentence: Genetic studies suggest that the presence of Darwin's tubercle is inherited as a dominant trait.
Label: Explanation

Sentence: While it does not serve any significant function in modern humans, Darwin's tubercle provides insight into the evolutionary changes in human anatomy.
Label: Purpose

Sentence: In conclusion, Darwin's tubercle is an example of a vestigial anatomical feature that highlights human evolutionary history.
Label: Summary
